jobs.description: About Ferrari Group As a one-stop service provider specializing in shipping, integrated logistics and high value-added services for precious goods worldwide, Ferrari Group is a leading corporation in the freight forwarding business for luxury clients.  Founded in Italy, now headquartered in London, UK, Ferrari group has a network of offices and agents in over 80 cities.  The Singapore office, with 3 offices across the city, is seeking talents to join our team in our expansion project.     Responsibilities And Requirements Handling full sets of accounts • Including checking and reviewing receipts, all payment and accruals of expenses to ensure completeness and adequacy of provision is done • Updating and checking customers and suppliers credit rating before input their details in the accounting system • Verifying transaction before posting into accounting system • Checking and posting GL entries • Preparing fixed assets, Prepayment, Depreciation and Right of use (ROU) schedule • Managing and oversee day to day flow transactions and approve payment to vendors and customers • Verifying the petty cash claims and payments • Keying payroll entries and prepare payroll reports to auditors • Preparing and submitting quarterly GST returns • Preparing audit scheduling and answering queries for corporate and local audit • Preparing and analysing month end financial report (TB, PL and BS) to the local management • Preparing quarterly report to HQ in London • Ability to communicate with the bankers, corporate secretary and auditors • Oversee and ensure accuracy of billing of invoices • Sending of SOA to customers/vendors • Other ad-hoc duties as assigned by the Management  Requirements • Minimum 3 years of relevant work experiences in an internal accounting environment Diploma/ Degree in Accountancy • Good understanding of FRS and accounting principles and statutory regulation • Negotiation and problem-solving skills • Strong written and oral communication skills • Good understanding of corporate governance, regulatory compliance and accounting principles • Good in Excel (Pivot Table, including Vlookup) • Experience in managing a team. To provide guidance and feedback to the team members and work under tight timelines • Able to communicate efficiently with stakeholders • Result-oriented • Short notice or immediate hiring preferred

The Role We are currently looking for an Accountant to be part of our finance team. As an accountant, your main responsibilities include but are not limited to; maintaining accurate books on accounts payable and receivable, payroll, and daily financial entries and reconciliations for our BCI Group business.   To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience with bookkeeping and a flair for spotting numerical mistakes. Ultimately, you will provide us with accurate quantitative information on the financial position, liquidity, and cash flows of our business, while ensuring we’re compliant with all tax regulations.   Responsibilities: - •	Plan, coordinate, and facilitate end-of-month processes and reporting for the Group such as Singapore, Hong Kong, and any other entities if required •	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable. •	Ensure all day-to-day financial transactions are processed in the accounting system, is accurate and timely manner – payment updates, processing client’s invoices etc. •	Review and finalize deferral schedule each month and post necessary journals •	Singapore’s Payroll administration – payroll processing and statutory requirement. •	Fixes Assets management – additions, disposals, reconciliations •	Review and finalize deferral schedule each month and post necessary journals •	Manage balance sheets and profit/loss statements •	Compute taxes and prepare tax returns. •	Handling queries related to accounts. •	Work closely with the Group team of accountants and CFO •	Support in finance, accounting and adhoc projects as required by the CFO.  Requirements: -  •	Degree or Diploma holder in Accounting, Commerce or Finance •	Minimum 5 years of working experience as Accounts or Finance officer •	Working experience in multinational companies and with remote teams •	Hands-on experience with liaising with auditors and managing audits •	Experience with Singapore GST filing •	Experience with managing intercompany transactions •	Understanding of Singapore payroll regulations and experience payroll administration •	Strong proficiency and hands- on experience in computing system including MS office, excel, payroll and reporting system •	In-depth understanding of general accounting principles. •	Good interpersonal skills, accuracy and attention to details.  Why Join BCI? •	Transparent working culture and supportive team! •	Regional team and exposure. •	Up to 20 days of Annual Leave per year •	Hybrid work arrangement (office ; home) •	Birthday ; Work Anniversary Leave. •	Medical Insurance Coverage   (Only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

Job Description: We are looking for a detail-oriented and organized Account Assistant to join our team. The Account Assistant will be responsible for providing support to the accounting team, processing transactions, reconciling accounts, and assisting with financial reporting. Responsibilities:    Assist with processing accounts payable and receivable transactions.   Reconcile bank and credit card statements on a monthly basis.   Prepare and submit invoices to clients and follow up on outstanding payments.   Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of financial transactions and documentation.   Assist with financial reporting, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.   Perform other general accounting duties as assigned by the accounting team.   Respond to accounting-related inquiries from internal and external stakeholders.  Requirements:    Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related field.   Minimum 1-2 years of experience in an accounting or finance role.   Knowledge of accounting principles and procedures.   Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other accounting software.   Strong attention to detail and accuracy.   Good communication and interpersonal skills.   Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.   Willingness to learn and grow within the accounting team.  If you are a motivated and reliable Account Assistant with a passion for accounting and finance, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

location.address: CARGO AGENTS BUILDING D, 9 AIRLINE ROAD

jobs.description: Job Description:    Assist in consolidation and reviewing of accounts for the group and subsidiaries.   Ensure timely submission of accounts by subsidiaries.   Ensure accounts submitted are in compliance with local accounting standards, group reporting requirements, tax, statutory, regulations and SGX/MAS requirement.   Implement head office internal control policies, procedures and reporting requirements.   Assist in preparing, monitoring and analysing management reports, forecasts and annual budgets.   Assist in reviewing of tax returns of local subsidiaries and foreign subsidiaries.   Liaise with auditors, tax agents, bankers, company secretaries, government agencies and external parties.   Assist with ad-hoc projects when required.   Requirements:    Possess CPA/CA preferred and Degree in Accountancy/Finance or other related professional discipline.   Minimum 3 years of related experience.   Competent in consolidation of group accounts.   Independent, meticulous and well organized.   Good interpersonal and written communication skills.   Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines in fast paced environment.   Possess "roll up my sleeves" mind set and ready to hands on whenever required.   Well-versed in Microsoft Office software.   Must have experience in stock exchange dealing rules.   Liaise with SGX on all compliance and corporate finance matters would be a big plus.

Key Attributes: Meticulous. Sharp. Systematic.  Role Description: True to all start-up, you will be the sole rep for finance and admin. Reporting to General Manager, you are responsible for day-to-day accounting function, property rental invoice management and office administration.  Experience: 8 years of experience in financial accounting and experience with property rental or investment management is a bonus. Ideally proficient with MYOB and Time Software.  Requirements:    Responsible for day-to-day accounting functions including month end closing, budgets and cashflow forecast, CPF and GST submissions, payroll, and AR/AP functions.   Preparation, review and analysis of management accounts. Corporate finance matters, feasibility studies, financial analysis and evaluation of performances, variance analysis, cost control also fall within the remit of the role.   In-charge of all office admin related matters and liaise with auditors, tax agents, MOM, IRAS, CPF Board and any other government authorities.  Education: Degree in accountancy or professional qualifications
Requirements     Min Degree in Accountancy   At least 2 years of relevant accounting experience   5 days work week   Working location in Novena

Organisation/Department Summary/Chart Reports to the Assistant Finance Manager Job Purpose: Primary Responsibilities · Prepares financial reports for general management use · Maintains company journals and ledgers · Performs reconciliations of company financial data, researches variances, and adjusts as needed · Enters, reviews, and/or approves financial transactions in company financial systems · Interprets and analyses financial reports for organisation management · Assist in the budgeting and forecasting process · Assists with special projects as assigned · Performs other duties as assigned Duties and Responsibilities: · Able to handle full set of accounts · Ensure timely and accurate financial and management reporting · Assist in the budgeting and forecasting process · Assist with internal or/and external audit · Assist to develop and implement the accounting procedures and policies · Ensure compliance with local statutory, tax, and regulatory requirements · Review and improve workflow · Liaise with bankers, external and internal auditors, tax and secretarial agents · Any other ad-hoc projects Requirements: Education/Professional Qualification · Degree in Accountancy or equivalent with minimum 3 to 5 years of relevant experience · Chartered Accountant certification preferred Preferred Skills/Experience · Good written and verbal communication skills · Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines · Ability to analyse data and make suggestions for adjustment or process improvements · Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint · Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central experience is preferred · Good interpersonal skills and a team player

Communicating with clients regarding billing and payments.   Handle and prepare full sets of accounts.   Maintaining client relationships.   At least one year' experience in a similar role.   Working hour: Mon-Fri, 0900 am-1830 pm.  Requirement:    Minimum “O” Level or ITE. Fresh graduate may apply.   Hardworking and willing to learn attitude.   Customer oriented, good communication and interpersonal skill.   Proficient in use of Excel, Word and Outlook.   Work well in a team.

Job Highlights    Fun Working Environment   Attractive Remuneration Package   Career Development Opportunity  Job Description We are an energetic team who are looking for a candidate passionate about continuous learning and pursue career development.  Why Join Us?    Leadership opportunity   Open discussion work environment   Gain career exposure   Career development opportunity   Work life balance   Company activities: Movie Day, company trip, etc...  Job Descriptions    Prepare and maintain full sets of accounts   Prepare monthly financial and management reports for companies   Consolidate accounts and ensure compliance with accounting standards   Support audit and tax queries   Compute taxes and prepare tax returns   Liaise with banks on banking transactions   Assist in annual budgeting, monitor cash flow   Publish financial statements in time   Report on the company’s financial health and liquidity   Coordinate and liaise with internal parties to support intercompany activities   Answer client's enquiries on accounting/ tax field   Handle tax, withholding tax and gst submission   Identify areas for improvement and implement improvements to processes  Requirements    Bachelor Degree in Accounting ; Finance or equivalent   At least 2-3 years of experience in accounting ; finance   Experience in Singapore tax, gst and witholding tax   Bilingual with proficiency in Mandarin preferred to liaise with Mandarin speaking client   Strong understanding of accounting principles   Ability to work independently with a high degree of accuracy and efficiency   Experience in accounting and secretarial services would be an advantage   Proficiency in accounting software: Xero Accounting would be an advantage   Able to work immediately or 1 month notices  Working Hours: Monday - Friday 9:30am - 6:00pm Location: Raffles Place  Interested candidate may submit your latest resume to lotusia.recruitment@gmail.com

As the Regional Senior Accountant for Asia, you will be responsible for overseeing the financial management and reporting of the organization's operations in the Asia region. You will ensure that all financial transactions are recorded accurately, in compliance with applicable accounting standards, and that all financial processes are efficient and effective.  Key Responsibilities: - General Accounting: Oversee and ensure the accuracy of the organization's day-to-day financial transactions, including accounts payable, accounts receivable,  general ledger accounting, and quarterly GST reports for IRAS filing.  Accounts Receivable: o Manage the accounts receivable process, including invoicing, collections, and customer account reconciliations. o Ensure the accurate and timely recording of all accounts receivable transactions in the accounting system, and reconcile accounts receivable to the general ledger. o Work with Stulz subsidiaries, partners in countries, or any customer accounts to resolve any billing disputes or discrepancies.  General Ledger Accounting: o Ensure the accurate and timely recording of all financial transactions in the general ledger, including journal entries, accruals, and prepayments. o Reconcile all balance sheet accounts on a monthly basis, investigate and resolve any discrepancies. o Assist with the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, ensuring compliance with local and international accounting standards.  - Financial Reporting: Ensure the timely and accurate preparation of financial statements, including profit and loss, balance sheets, and cash flow statements, in compliance with local and international accounting standards. - Budgeting and Forecasting: Work with Asia local and regional teams to develop and implement annual budgets and forecasts, providing insights and analysis to support decision-making. - Internal Controls: Ensure that all financial processes and procedures are in compliance with the organization's internal control policies, and identify areas for improvement. - Tax Compliance: Work with external tax partner to ensure compliance with all relevant tax regulations, including preparing and filing tax returns, and providing support during tax audits. - Audit Management: Work with external auditors to ensure the timely and accurate completion of annual audits, and provide support during audit-related inquiries. - ERP system: Oversee the ERP system to ensure that it is functioning optimally and meeting the financial needs of the organization.  Key Requirements: · Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field. · Professional accounting certification (e.g. CPA, CA, ACCA) preferred. · Minimum of 8 years of experience in accounting, with at least 3 years of experience in a senior accounting role. · Strong understanding of accounting principles, regulations, and practices. · Experience with financial management software, such as SAP or Oracle will be a plus. · Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to provide insights and recommendations based on financial data. · Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate financial information to non-financial stakeholders.

Responsibilities:     Handle full sets of accounts   Handle accounting assignments independently   Perform monthly accounts closing and relevant reports   Maintain accounting files and records   Assist in preparing financial statements and schedules   Handle tax filing for corporate clients   Assist with GST filings / registration   Ensuring timely completion of audit / accounts and ensuring meeting monthly budget / billing  Requirements:     A recognized degree in accountancy / professional qualification from an international accounting Institute   At least 1-year working experience in audit or accounting field   Bookkeeping knowledge   Strong analytical skills, resourceful, able to work independently and as a team player   Committed to work under tight deadlines   Good command of English with strong inter-personal and communications skill   Eye for details   Computer literate and proficient in MS Office   Pleasant disposition   Candidate seeking long term employment

Proven working experience as Accounting Manager, Accounting Supervisor or Finance Manager   Advanced computer skills on MS Office, accounting software and databases   Ability to manipulate large amounts of data   Proven knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting principles, practices, standards, laws and regulations   High attention to detail and accuracy   Ability to direct and supervise   BS degree in Accounting or Finance

~ Prepare accurate and timely financial statements. ~ Calculate taxable income and the income tax liabilities of the organisation. ~ Calculate the cost of different types of capital financial instruments and the overall costs of capital for the organisation. ~ Compile accurate tax-related information for the organisation. ~ Compute the valuation of business and financial assets using different models. ~ Ensure the respective privileges and rights are in place within the accounting information system for users with different job roles and functions. ~ Extract data and provide analysis for management using relevant accounting information systems or software. ~ Implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls to prevent possible fraud and errors. ~ Maintain accurate journal entries and allocations. ~ Manage accounts payable and receivables to help the organisation determine working capital needs and funding strategies. ~ Operate accounting information systems efficiently and effectively. ~ Participate in budgeting and forecasting activities. ~ Plan and coordinate the annual financial audit process. ~ Prepare asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analysing account information. ~ Prepare financial statements and disclosure notes. ~ Provide accurate and timely tax and financial reports to the relevant authorities. ~ Provide data in relation to assets, capital rationing and cost of capital. ~ Reconcile accounts and provide analysis for the organisations financial transactions. ~ Resolve issues and deficiencies arising from audit findings. ~ Respond to internal and external auditors on audit data, variances and audit findings.
